body.class: mediawiki ltr ns-6 ns-subject page-File_Flag_of_Belarus_svg skin-vector

div.p: Flag_of_Belarus.svg‎ (SVG file, nominally 1,200 × 600 pixels, file size: 10 KB)

This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons. Information from its description page there is shown below.
Commons is a freely licensed media file repository. You can help.

a.title: This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons

img.alt: This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons

p.style: width:30em; border:2px solid #55b05a; margin:1px 0; background:#fff; color:#000;

div.p: W3C ✓ The source code of this SVG is valid
div.div: Словѣ́ньскъ / ⰔⰎⰑⰂⰡⰐⰠⰔⰍⰟ: Бѣлꙑ́ Роуси́ Димократі́ѩ ꙁна́мѧ
div.p: The national flag of Belarus. New version replaces Zscout's "raster embedded in svg" image. The exact colours aren't officially defined; the colours used in this image are Pantone 1795C for red and 370C for green as estimated in Album des Pavillons (see en:Flag of Belarus).

table.style: border:2px solid #d3d3d3; background-color:white; clear: both; margin: 0.5em auto; width:100%; text-align:center; cellpadding:0px; direction:ltr;

tr.td: It is easy to put a border around this image:

p.span: العربية | Беларуская (тарашкевіца) | Català | Česky | Dansk | Deutsch | Ελληνικά | English | Esperanto | Español | Eesti | Euskara | Suomi | Français | Galego | Hrvatski | Magyar | Հայերեն | Bahasa Indonesia | Italiano | 日本語 | ქართული | 한국어 | Lietuvių | Македонски | Bahasa Melayu | Malti | Nederlands | ‪Norsk (bokmål)‬ | Polski | Português | Runa Simi | Română | Русский | Slovenčina | Српски / Srpski | Svenska | Türkçe | 中文 | ‪中文(简体)‬ | ‪中文(繁體)‬ | +/−

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f7f8ff; border:2px solid #8888aa; direction: ltr;

tr.td:
This work is not an object of copyright according to the Law of the Belarus No. 370-XIII of May 16, 1996 on Copyright and Neighbouring Rights.
Article 8. Works that are not Objects of Copyright
Shall not be objects of copyright:
formal documents (laws, judgements, other texts of legal, administrative and judicial nature), and also their official translations;
state symbols and signs (flag, coat of arms, anthem, awards, banknotes and other signs[1]);
works of folk arts, authors of which are not known.
Copyright does not cover ideas, processes, systems, methods of operation, concepts, principles, discoveries or simply information as such, even if they are expressed, reflected, explained or embodied in the work.
Full text of the Law: in Russian, in English.
↑ Postage stamps are state signs according to the Article 1 of the Law of the Republic of Belarus No. 258-З of December 15, 2003 on Mail Service (ru)

td.p: Comment – According to interstate and international compacts the Republic of Belarus is the legal successor of the Byelorussian Soviet Socialist Republic, therefore this license tag is also applicable to official symbols and formal documents of the Byelorussian SSR.
Warning – This license tag cannot be applied to proposed official symbols and drafts of the formal documents, which can be copyrighted.

p.span: Беларуская | Беларуская (тарашкевіца) | English | Македонски | Русский | Українська | +/−

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f7f8ff; border:2px solid #8888aa; direction: ltr;

span.i: This image has been released into the public domain by its author, Zscout370. This applies worldwide.

span.small: In some countries this may not be legally possible; if so:
span.i: Zscout370 grants anyone the right to use this work for any purpose, without any conditions, unless such conditions are required by law.

p.span: Alemannisch | العربية | Беларуская (тарашкевіца) | Български | Català | Česky | Deutsch | Ελληνικά | English | Español | Eesti | فارسی | Suomi | Français | עברית | Magyar | Italiano | 日本語 | 한국어 | Lietuvių | Македонски | മലയാളം | Malti | Plattdüütsch | Nederlands | Polski | Português | Português do Brasil | Русский | Српски / Srpski | Svenska | தமிழ் | ไทย | Türkçe | Українська | Vèneto | Tiếng Việt | 中文 | ‪中文(简体)‬ | ‪中文(繁體)‬ | +/−

div.p: Click on a date/time to view the file as it appeared at that time.

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 08:44, 11 May 2010

td.span: (There is a major line going through the ornament and it bothers me. Went with the easy code on the stripes/bars, but kept the previous combined ornament (while removing several duplicate/not needed points).)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 01:33, 25 February 2010

td.span: (fixed markup errors: IDs cannot start with a number. You were lucky rsvg and Firefox are too lenient on code validity.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 06:34, 15 September 2009

td.span: (Compression of a code. The ornament is taken from a site [http://www.vexilla-mundi.com/belarus_flag.html Vexilla-mundi].)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 21:40, 11 January 2008

td.span: (I have corrected colors and have reduced the size of the file.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 10:16, 9 January 2008
Thumbnail for version as of 03:13, 18 January 2007

td.span: (Something about the ornament bothered me, so I fixed it in about 2 hours)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 05:41, 7 March 2006

td.span: (http://www.maraphon.com/index.php?section=production&razdel=flags says the ornament is 1/12th of the width of the flag.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 23:22, 17 February 2006

td.span: (using Pantone 1795C for red and 370C for green (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Belarus), conversion in Photoshop)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 16:44, 17 December 2005
Thumbnail for version as of 06:52, 14 September 2005

td.span: (Optimize SVG of Zscout's version: remove hacks, fix display bugs, reduce size, and name objects.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 23:17, 12 September 2005
Thumbnail for version as of 21:38, 12 September 2005

td.span: (New rendition of Belarus flag, created in Inkscape. {{GFDL-1.2}})
